title: How to Make Money in RuneScape as a Member

steps.title: Gear up.
steps.content: Gear up. Barrows is a high level mini-game that involves fighting 6 brothers and the looting the chest for a chance at their armor. Be no less than 70 in each of your preferred skill. Magic would be the most effective as 4 of the 6 brothers are weak to an elemental magic, however melee and range are viable options as well. Take Plenty of food, and 3 or 4 prayer potions. Note that you require a shovel in Osrs, but not in RS3.

steps.title: Get to Mort'ton.
steps.content: Get to Mort'ton. If you have completed the quest "In Aid of Myreque", you can use the shortcut underneath the bar in Canfis, otherwise you have to go through the swap and around the maze. Go just East of the Shades of Mort'ton minigame and you'll see 6 mounds, dig up one to go to the brother.

steps.title: Fight the brothers.
steps.content: Fight the brothers. Each of them have their special perks, however Dharok is the one to look out for. The lower health he has, the higher damage he has a potential to deal. Protect from melee or similar prayers are highly recommended, as he can one-hit you without prayer.

steps.title: Enter the crypt.
steps.content: Enter the crypt. In one of the brothers tomb's you will find that there is a tunnel leading to a crypt. Only enter this after all 5 of the other brothers are killed. Here you will have to go through a series of doors to get to the center, the final door requiring you to answer a puzzle. Once you have done that, go through the door.

steps.title: Loot the chest.
steps.content: Loot the chest. As you attempt to the final brother you did not fight originally will appear. Kill him and then loot the chest. You are looking to get one of their items, the most valuable include Guthan's armor and weapon and Karil's Crossbow.

steps.title: Get level 92 Runecrafting.
steps.content: Get level 92 Runecrafting. It's technically possible to do this at 44, but it will halve your profits. It is fastest to do this at Runespan, and easily AFKable. With the tokens you get, buy all 4 essence pouches.

steps.title: Using the abyss.
steps.content: Using the abyss. Get your pouches full of essence, and have an inventory of essence. Be wearing a glory amulet and any weight reducing items you have run north from Edgeville to the Abyss teleport.

steps.title: Go through the abyss to the nature altar room.
steps.content: Go through the abyss to the nature altar room. Craft all your nature runes. You don't need to take the essence out of the pouch in rs3 as it automatically does it.

steps.title: Teleport with your glory back to Edgeville.
steps.content: Teleport with your glory back to Edgeville. Bank your nature runes and refill your pouches and inventory. If need be, rest for a few seconds to regain run energy. Repeat the process for as long as you like

steps.title: Using the sprit graahk method.
steps.content: Using the sprit graahk method. Get 57 summoning. Buy a few dozen spirit graahk pouches and a nature tiara. Do the same thing as before, having a glory and filling your pouches. This time, click the teleport option on your graahk to be teleported to Karamja, just a small run away from the nature altar.

steps.title: Run to the nature altar.
steps.content: Run to the nature altar. Go into the altar with your tiara equipped and craft your nature runes.

steps.title: Teleport back to Edgeville.
steps.content: Teleport back to Edgeville. Again, fill your pouches and inventory, and refill your summoning points at the summoning altar if need be. Repeat the process

steps.title: Get 63 hunter.
steps.content: Get 63 hunter. Buy 4-5 traps depending on your level and how many you can use, and teleport to Feldip Hills, some methods of getting there include Gnome Gliders (after The Grand Tree), Feldip Hill teleport scrolls from clue rewards, or the Oo'glog lodestone teleport and running north. Go west of the hunter master.

steps.title: Lay down your trap in a diamond shape.
steps.content: Lay down your trap in a diamond shape. This allows you to catch the chinchompas in the most efficient method, and makes it easier to replace the traps afterward. Don't bother smoking or baiting your traps, as the bonus to catching is not worth the time and money spent on getting them.

steps.title: Go to the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon.
steps.content: Go to the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon. This requires 85 dungeoneering, and a a decently high combat level. Dual Drygores should be used for maximum kills, but chaotic weapons and even God swords can be used in a pinch. Bring a pack yak or similar pet as well to make trips last longer.

steps.title: Buy some magic notepaper.
steps.content: Buy some magic notepaper. This is a treasure hunter prize, and allows you to note any drops you get. Doing this may cut into your profit a little bit, however it allows you to stay for longer, therefore allowing you to increase your profit per hour.

steps.title: Kill the Frost dragons and collect their bones.
steps.content: Kill the Frost dragons and collect their bones. Frost dragon bones give the best prayer experience in the game, so they are in constant need for people that are training prayer.

steps.title: Check the GE.
steps.content: Check the GE. Most herbs are more expensive clean than grimy, as they are needed for fast herblore training. Some good ones are Kwuarm and Lantadymes. Buy as many of them as you can.

steps.title: Teleport to a one-click bank.
steps.content: Teleport to a one-click bank. Good ones are the Castle Wars chest and the Soul Wars chest. Set up your bank presets so that you can click the preset and get an inventory of grimy herbs.

steps.title: Clean the herbs, You will get about 50k exp/hour while doing this method, and will make quite a profit from doing so.
steps.content: Clean the herbs, You will get about 50k exp/hour while doing this method, and will make quite a profit from doing so.

steps.title: Buy clean or grimy herbs.
steps.content: Buy clean or grimy herbs. Grimy herbs will give you more profit, but will take quite a bit longer. Alternatively, you could combine this with the previous method and use the herbs from that. Buy an equal amount of vials to herbs.

steps.title: Set a preset.
steps.content: Set a preset. Set a bank present that you will have 14 vials of water and 14 of the herbs. Combine them to make unfinished potions. Almost all the potions will make you profit, the most profitable being fellstalk, which requires 91 herblore.

steps.title: Get at least 57 Construction.
steps.content: Get at least 57 Construction. Building and destroying oak larders are the best way to level up your construction. Build an observatory in your house, and then a mahogany demon or Eagle Lectern.

steps.title: Buy your supplies.
steps.content: Buy your supplies. Buy at least 1,000 soft clay and law runes. You can either have an air battlestaff or an earth battlestaff, however buy the rune that you do not have the staff in with the same quantity as your law runes.

steps.title: Hire the highest butler you can.
steps.content: Hire the highest butler you can. Go to Ardougne just north of the market. Talk to the Butler Master about buying a butler. The demon butler gives you the most money, however costs the most to hire and the most to keep using. When doing this method, keep a few hundred thousand in your money pouch to pay your butler.

steps.title: Go to your house and make house teleport tabs.
steps.content: Go to your house and make house teleport tabs. As you run out of money, call your butler and ask him to fetch 25 soft clay from the bank, the maximum he can carry. After 5-7 tasks he will require a 10k payment, and toggling this as auto helps speed up the process. The tabs stack, so banking is not needed.

steps.title: Know the requirements:
steps.content: Know the requirements: Have 30-100k on hand. Weight reducing items can help (Boots of Lightness, Spotted Cape, Penance Gloves, etc.) This method is completely safe for any level character.

steps.title: Talk to NPC's that have a shop, or can possibly sell something to you.
steps.content: Talk to NPC's that have a shop, or can possibly sell something to you.

steps.title: Sell the items to the Grand Exchange when done.
steps.content: Sell the items to the Grand Exchange when done. One thing to keep in mind is whether it's worth it to buy and resell a certain item. Generally, you should only buy items that are sold in bulk (more than 25), and that give you 100 GP profit per item (or more). Below are some nice places to start your trip.

steps.title: Bagged plants 1.
steps.content: Bagged plants 1. These are used in summoning training when making the stranger pouch plant. These can be bought from a gardener in Falador park for 1k a piece. They can be sold for around 2k each on grand exchange. Be very sure you buy bagged plant 1 and not the other ones as they do not sell.

steps.title: Culinaromancer's Chest.
steps.content: Culinaromancer's Chest. After completing at least 1 quest in the Recipe for Disaster quest, you can access this chest, however it is recommended to have all of the quest completed for most profit. You can buy chocolate bars, cooking apples, and grapes and resell for a profit.

steps.title: Mithril Seeds.
steps.content: Mithril Seeds. After completing Legend's Quest, you can buy mithril seeds on the top floor. You can then resell these on Grand Exchange.

steps.title: Vial of Water Packs.
steps.content: Vial of Water Packs. These can be bought in southern Ardougne, and then reselling them to the grand exchange.

steps.title: Battlestaves.
steps.content: Battlestaves. You can buy these from Zaff in Varrock square every 24 hours. You can originally only buy 12, but depending on the level of Varrock Achievement diaries you've completed you can buy up to 84 a day.

steps.title: Get the runes you need.
steps.content: Get the runes you need. You are going to need a cosmic rune for every piece you intend to charge, along with an elemental rune depending on what piece you enchant, earth for emerald, water for sapphire, fire for ruby, and air for diamond.

steps.title: Know what jewelry to enchant for profit.
steps.content: Know what jewelry to enchant for profit. Some examples include: Emerald Rings. When enchanted, these turn into Rings of Duelling, which are commonly used as teleports to the bank and in hard clues. Dragonstone Amulets. These turn into Amulets of Glory, used again in fast teleporting to the Edgeville bank and a Hard clue that requires a teleport into the Karamja Jungle. Sapphire Necklaces. These turn into Games Necklaces, which yet again are used in teleportation to Barbarian Assault. Sapphire Rings. These turn into rings of recoil, which are commonly used by PKers due to the fact they return 10% of damage to the attacker.

steps.title: Go to the GE and buy 200 Mithril Seeds for the medium price.
steps.content: Go to the GE and buy 200 Mithril Seeds for the medium price. Depending on supply and demand this can take anywhere from a few seconds to a few days.

steps.title: Go to an area where it is very green and click on one of the Mithril Seeds and a bunch of flowers will appear.
steps.content: Go to an area where it is very green and click on one of the Mithril Seeds and a bunch of flowers will appear. Click (Pick flowers) and the flowers will appear in your backpack.

steps.title: Go back to the GE and sell the flowers for as much as you would like.
steps.content: Go back to the GE and sell the flowers for as much as you would like. Some flowers will sell quickly and some will not. The ones that will not sell quickly you can price lower and they will sell almost instantly.

steps.title: Know the requirements:
steps.content: Know the requirements: Rune Hatchet. As you progress your Woodcutting level, it is highly recommended that you upgrade your hatchet as well. Depending on what you choose to do, it's best to make money while doing this to get better hatchets. Level 1-15: Cut regular Logs. This will take a while because you have just started. Don't buy an iron hatchet as it is a waste of money and will not make much of a difference Level 15-30: Cut Oak Logs. You earn around 1,000 gold from Oak Logs. Use a Mithril Hatchet when you get to level 21 in Woodcutting. Get ready to use the Adamant Hatchet at level 31. Level 30-60: Cut Willow logs. Willow logs are fast exp, but their locations aren't normally quiet. You won't make much money with these trees, but enough to buy a Rune Hatchet (requires 41 Woodcutting). You can get magic seeds worth up to 150,000gp from birds nests here. Skip cutting down maples. These become available at level 45, but they are slow to cut down and not as good money per hour as willows. Levels 60-99: You can start cutting down Yews. But it will be rather slow to get a full inventory. Instead, you should stick with Willows until 75 woodcutting, as they have fast experience. Level 68-75: You are now at the level to chop Choking Ivy. It's not very slow; this is the best way to get experience, but not money. You can start on this at any level (68 or above). (This is a very good strategy for those that would like to get a few levels in one night). Level 60-75: At 61 Woodcutting, you are able to use a Dragon Hatchet which costs around quite a bit of money. Begin cutting Yew Logs. The recommended place to cut being Seers' Village just south of the Flax field. Levels 75-90: Cut Magic Logs between these levels. It is highly recommended that you use a dragon hatchet. If you can't afford it, then stick with the Rune Hatchet. Magic Logs can be very slow to cut at the required level. If you want to, stay with the yew trees until around 85-90. Magic logs have a profit of 1.3k each, and the best way for making money for members with Woodcutting. As of the 27/5/10 (DD/MM/YY), magic logs are roughly 1500 gp each on the Grand Exchange, but can increase or decrease depending on the time. Levels 90-99: Cut Elder Logs. Not only are they a decent source of 500k+ gp per hour, but they are also extremely AFK. Just start cutting an elder tree and you will not have to pay attention to your screen for 5 minutes. Elder Logs sell for around 4000 gp each.

Get enough money to buy a dueling ring so you can teleport yourself to castle wars, if you do not wish to teleport there you can walk there south of Ardougne. Using the bank chest in the Castle wars main lobby, drop everything off into your bank. Withdraw your hatchet, for faster money making use only a hatchet you can wield and you can use with your woodcutting level. Leave the building wielding your hatchet and cross the south bridge, instantly go west until you see leafless, spiny trees called "Achey Tree's" Cut Achey Tree's until full inventory and go back to the bank chest in the Castle Wars lobby and deposit all your Achey tree logs in your bank. Repeat the process as many times as you like. Make a reasonable amount of money off 200 logs, which is 8 runs, But it is suggested that you continue and collect more! Teleport to the lodestone in Varrock. Go to the Grand Exchange. Withdraw all your logs in note form and sell all of them in the Grand Exchange for minimum price. They should sell immediately.

steps.title: Understand the risks.
steps.content: Understand the risks. By killing these bots, you are Skulling and risking whatever you bring, and therefore should bring as little as possible. This being said, have about 70 magic. You cannot do this method if you are above around 90 combat, as you won't be able to attack the bots

steps.title: Gear up.
steps.content: Gear up. You are trying to keep your risk as low as possible, so buying an air battlestaff and using wind blast is recommended. Have a ring of Kinship in your inventory, and about 5 pieces of food.

steps.title: Teleport to Daemonheim.
steps.content: Teleport to Daemonheim. Travel west from until you reach a gate to the wilderness. Go through the gate, then travel north until you see the bots.

steps.title: Kill the bots.
steps.content: Kill the bots. Use your magic abilities and kill the bots. They will run south and try to home teleport, however your attack will interrupt it. When they die, pick up their dragon bones and green dragonhide, and teleport back to Daemonheim, rinse and repeat.

steps.title: Sell the bones and hides.
steps.content: Sell the bones and hides. You made money and helped clean up RuneScape! Be sure to report the bots before you kill them

steps.title: Go to a mine that has quite a few Iron and Coal rocks(Mining Guild has lots of coal) and mine about 1000 Iron and about 2000 Coal and make lots of Steel Bars(which range from 750-900gp on the Grand Exchange).
steps.content: Go to a mine that has quite a few Iron and Coal rocks(Mining Guild has lots of coal) and mine about 1000 Iron and about 2000 Coal and make lots of Steel Bars(which range from 750-900gp on the Grand Exchange). Next, go to a forge and make them into cannonballs. To make these you need to have completed Dwarf Cannon and have a cannonball mold. This requires 35 mining and smiting

steps.title: Another method is to buy Iron and Coal off the Grand Exchange at a 1:2 ratio and turn them into Steel Bars.
steps.content: Another method is to buy Iron and Coal off the Grand Exchange at a 1:2 ratio and turn them into Steel Bars. Making about 800 coins a set. Ardougne East Mine has 11 Iron and 13 Coal rocks.

steps.title: If you have level 60 smithing, you can do the same thing at the blast furnace in keldagrim with a 1:1 ratio.
steps.content: If you have level 60 smithing, you can do the same thing at the blast furnace in keldagrim with a 1:1 ratio. also there is an ore store right by the furnace.

steps.title: Know the requirements:
steps.content: Know the requirements: Any combat level, 75+ preferred, an anti-dragon shield, dragonfire shield, or a few anti-fire potions all prevent the dragon's breath, which can hit upwards of 2000.

steps.title: Go North west of Edgeville in the wilderness.Fight Green Dragons and take their bones, hides, Clue Scrolls, and valuable drops.
steps.content: Go North west of Edgeville in the wilderness.Fight Green Dragons and take their bones, hides, Clue Scrolls, and valuable drops. If you want, you can pick up the coins and if you have an Explorers' Ring, you can use Low Alchemy on the low-worth drops. If you see that your potion's effects are dropping, take another dose.

steps.title: Bank and repeat.
steps.content: Bank and repeat. The closest banks are in Edgeville, or Daemonheim with the ring of Kinship. Depending on your combat level, you can make 200k-800k an hour if you save up your drops. Make a small tab for them under your bank, if you like.

steps.title: Magic is an effective way to kill dragons if there is a safe spot as in Red Dragon isle.
steps.content: Magic is an effective way to kill dragons if there is a safe spot as in Red Dragon isle.

steps.title: Using Dwarf cannon (Requires quest:
steps.content: Using Dwarf cannon (Requires quest: Dwarf cannon), may speed things up, however, you are likely to be flamed as it tends to take multiple kills, generally annoying other players. You can leave it running while you bank. Remember to pick up when you are told it is about to degrade.

steps.title: Remember to take a Varrock teleport so when a Player killer attacks, you can use it and get away or kill him/her.
steps.content: Remember to take a Varrock teleport so when a Player killer attacks, you can use it and get away or kill him/her. If you're using a weapon make sure you always have a anti-dragon shield and strength,defense,or attack potions.

steps.title: Know the requirements:
steps.content: Know the requirements: Any kind of hatchet. At least 875 Gold. Knowledge of the Brimhaven Dungeon. 70+ ranged Black dragonhide, snakeskin boots, Archer ring, Archer helm. Optional or full void, bring ranging potions it will help you kill them faster. Bring Alching runes for the rune limb drops, etc. Ring of Wealth Rune crossbow Broad bolts are highly recommended. Anti-dragonfire Shield (this will afford you good fire protection). Bring at least 1 anti-fire potion if you don't have a shield. (bring both anti and the shield for full protection.) A charged Amulet of Glory, or some sort of teleportation tablet (Ardougne Teleport suggested).

steps.title: Make your way to Brimhaven Dungeon entrance, give Saniboch 875 gold, and enter the dungeon.
steps.content: Make your way to Brimhaven Dungeon entrance, give Saniboch 875 gold, and enter the dungeon.

steps.title: Make your way to the fire giants, and go to the last vine.
steps.content: Make your way to the fire giants, and go to the last vine.

steps.title: Run past Black Demons.
steps.content: Run past Black Demons. The North chamber leads to Red Dragons, East chamber leads to Bronze dragons, and South chamber leads to Iron/Steel Dragons (recommended). If you go to the Iron/Steel chamber, drink your anti-fire potion. There are sure to be a lot of people there, so go to the East part of the chamber. There are usually any people in the iron dragons there. If you are looking for Steel dragons, head to the middle. Kill one, and pick up dragon bones. If you go to the Bronze Dragon Chamber, make sure you have drunk a dose of antifire potion. Kill a dragon, and pick up the dragon bones.

steps.title: Teleport out of the Brimhaven Dungeon and deposit your inventory at the nearest bank.
steps.content: Teleport out of the Brimhaven Dungeon and deposit your inventory at the nearest bank. Each trip you could possibly make 30 thousand gold or more. It depends on how many dragon bones you get. If you collect 20, then that is quite a bit of money. If you get the rare Draconic Visage drop, then teleport out of there, head to the Grand Exchange, and sell it. Dragonic Visages are rarely dropped by steel or iron dragons. They usually sell for roughly 1.5 million.

steps.title: Get your items.
steps.content: Get your items. For this way of making money you will need: Noose wand is a must. Polar camo top and bottom would be helpful. You'll also need 35 agility to scale some rocks leading to a cave.

steps.title: Teleport to the lodestone in Relleka.
steps.content: Teleport to the lodestone in Relleka. If you do not have this lodestone active then you can walk north of Seers Village

steps.title: Go north up the east side of Relleka until you get to the rock crabs and just go a tiny bit north till you get to a little island.
steps.content: Go north up the east side of Relleka until you get to the rock crabs and just go a tiny bit north till you get to a little island. You should find sabre toothed kyatts(level 55-60) keep going north until you find some steps made of ice; ascend the steps and talk to the hunting expert in the area.

steps.title: Ask the hunting expert about polar kebbits, and then you can start hunting!
steps.content: Ask the hunting expert about polar kebbits, and then you can start hunting! You just need to play dot to dot, if the tracks go in a burrow search the other burrows in the area until the tracks come out. Their furs sell for roughy 1.5k each and a full inventory is about 42k. This is a great way to make money but it can be slow and boring, just keep in your head every time you catch one you get 1.5.k

steps.title: Keep in mind some hunting tips.
steps.content: Keep in mind some hunting tips. Polar kebbits will always hide in snow drifts so always attack the snow drifts! A good bank to deposit your wares in is Keldagrim (the dwarven city) just south of your area. If you've been to Keldagrim before by boat, you can get there by using a trap door in the Grand Exchange perimeters. Its at the top left corner near the agility shortcut to Edgeville.

steps.title: Meet the basic requirements.
steps.content: Meet the basic requirements. It would be helpful to have 50+ fishing. Before you go, remember the swamp tar is for holes, the bailing bucket is for floods and the rope is for the trawler nets.

steps.title: Use a ring of duelling and teleport to Castle Wars and head south towards the Fight Arena (just before Oo'glog) then head straight towards Yanille and pass through.
steps.content: Use a ring of duelling and teleport to Castle Wars and head south towards the Fight Arena (just before Oo'glog) then head straight towards Yanille and pass through.

steps.title: Pick up any items of clothing you want to wear it doesn't really matter and collect about 15k-20k.
steps.content: Pick up any items of clothing you want to wear it doesn't really matter and collect about 15k-20k.

steps.title: Head out the other end of Yanille by the bank to Port Khazard.
steps.content: Head out the other end of Yanille by the bank to Port Khazard.

steps.title: Go into the general store nearest to the port and buy:
steps.content: Go into the general store nearest to the port and buy: a bailing bucket, 10 rope and 500 swamp tar this will last you for over 2 hours

steps.title: Switch over to World 116 and wait on the boat nearest to Murphy it may say someone else is on a fishing trip but it comes back every 10-11 minutes.
steps.content: Switch over to World 116 and wait on the boat nearest to Murphy it may say someone else is on a fishing trip but it comes back every 10-11 minutes. Earn roughly 15k per round and about 5x that in an hour.

steps.title: Go to Nardah and kill goats (level 23) west of the bank.
steps.content: Go to Nardah and kill goats (level 23) west of the bank. Goats drop horns 100% of the time.

steps.title: Bank these or use a pestle and mortar on them to turn them into horn dust.
steps.content: Bank these or use a pestle and mortar on them to turn them into horn dust.

steps.title: Sell your wares on the Grand Exchange.
steps.content: Sell your wares on the Grand Exchange. Use the rug merchants for quick, safe travel. They cost 200 gold per trip. It's a good idea to wear desert gear and have water skins on hand at all times when you are in the desert. You can purchase water and desert gear from Shantay at Shantay's Pass. If your combat is under 60, bring food and a rune or better weapon. Goats are quite strong for their level.

steps.title: Go to Edgeville Dungeon.
steps.content: Go to Edgeville Dungeon. Follow the main tunnel north and then east. The Chaos Druids are in the North-western corner of the wilderness part of Edgeville dungeon Dungeon.

steps.title: Kill them until you have a full inventory of herbs.
steps.content: Kill them until you have a full inventory of herbs. Get ranarr or higher herbs.

steps.title: Sell your herbs at the Grand Exchange or save them for another time.
steps.content: Sell your herbs at the Grand Exchange or save them for another time.

steps.title: Repeat the process.
steps.content: Repeat the process. Bring teleport runes so you don't waste time walking to the bank. You will still have to walk to the Chaos Druids as there is no direct teleport to them. It is recommended to be Combat Level 35 or higher to make the killing faster. If the world is too crowded change worlds. On very crowded worlds like World 2 it is rather polite to keep the gate open for the massive amount of Air Orb Runners on these worlds.

steps.title: Don't pick Grimy Guam, Tarromin, Marrentill, because they're not very profitable.
steps.content: Don't pick Grimy Guam, Tarromin, Marrentill, because they're not very profitable. These herbs are worth less than a few hundred so it would be wasteful to pick up them in place of more expensive herbs such as avantoe or ranarr One of the npcs at the Grand Exchange can tell you the herb prices. You can be killed by other players in this dungeon so be careful.

steps.title: Go into the Chaos Druid resource Dungeon.
steps.content: Go into the Chaos Druid resource Dungeon. If you have level 20 Dungeoneering, you can go into the dungeon right beside the chaos druids. In here there are 13 chaos druid spawns, along with ranarr and irit herb spawns.

steps.title: Get the following skills and equipment:
steps.content: Get the following skills and equipment: Combat level 35 or higher Appropriate armor and weapons (adamant or higher is best the same for weapons)

steps.title: Head down to the Stronghold of Security.
steps.content: Head down to the Stronghold of Security. The Stronghold of Security can be found in the center of the Gunnar's Ground, west of Varrock.

steps.title: Go to the second level.
steps.content: Go to the second level.

steps.title: Find a room with flesh crawlers but few people.
steps.content: Find a room with flesh crawlers but few people.

steps.title: Begin to kill the flesh crawlers.
steps.content: Begin to kill the flesh crawlers. After awhile, you'll notice that they are dropping tons of herbs, runes, ores and very rarely they drop uncut sapphires and diamonds which are worth quite a bit. Pick up all fire runes, all nature runes and only the ranarrs, kwuarm, and other high leveled herbs (if you have the herblore level to do so, you can pick up the lower level herbs to clean them for the exp then drop them). After you have over 2000 fires runes and 75 nature runes, you should have a full inventory of herbs.

steps.title: Sell all these things in the Grand Exchange.
steps.content: Sell all these things in the Grand Exchange. You can make around about 380k per trip if you pick up only the noted ores, natures, fires and higher leveled herbs. Using the Ring of Wealth will not help with the drops, but will help you get access to the rare drop table

steps.title: Buy as many royal d'hides as you can.
steps.content: Buy as many royal d'hides as you can. You can buy them from the G.E.

steps.title: Withdraw 27 royal dragon hides.
steps.content: Withdraw 27 royal dragon hides. Go to the tanner south of the Varrock east bank and have him tan an inventory of royal d'hides. Each d'hide costs 20 coins to tan.

steps.title: Bank and repeat until all of your d'hides have been tanned.
steps.content: Bank and repeat until all of your d'hides have been tanned.

steps.title: Sell the tanned hides on the Grand Exchange.
steps.content: Sell the tanned hides on the Grand Exchange. Check the prices on the Grand Exchange to calculate your profit and decide whether it is worth the time and effort of making these

steps.title: Kill Jungle Spiders.
steps.content: Kill Jungle Spiders. These are located on Brimhaven, They drop spider carcasses, which are used in summoning. Be sure to bring anti-poison, as they can poison you.

steps.title: Keep in mind some spider tips:
steps.content: Keep in mind some spider tips: You can get to the island more easily if you have access to the Fairy Tale G.E. You can also get there by using ring of dueling and teleporting to Castle Wars, then walking. Also you could teleport to Watchtower after completing the Watchtower Quest. You can also get there by teleporting to ardougne and getting a boat over to brimhaven, or moving your house to brimhaven and teleporting to your house.

steps.title: There is more jungle spiders near Hazelmere, west of yanille on the far end island.
steps.content: There is more jungle spiders near Hazelmere, west of yanille on the far end island.

steps.title: Meet the requirements:
steps.content: Meet the requirements: At least 75 woodcutting (80+ is highly recommended, as without this you will barely be making any money)

steps.title: Go to the Sorcerer's Tower and cut magic trees.
steps.content: Go to the Sorcerer's Tower and cut magic trees. There are 4 magic trees in front of the Sorcerer's Tower and 3 directly Northwest of it. Magic tree logs give 250 experience each.

steps.title: Deposit your logs at the Seer's Village, Ardougne or Legends Guild Bank when your inventory is full.
steps.content: Deposit your logs at the Seer's Village, Ardougne or Legends Guild Bank when your inventory is full.

steps.title: Repeat.
steps.content: Repeat. Try to get 500 or 600 logs a day.

steps.title: Sell at the Grand Exchange.
steps.content: Sell at the Grand Exchange. This will net you huge profit depending on the price of the magic logs.

steps.title: Keep in mind some tips for this method:
steps.content: Keep in mind some tips for this method: You can also cut magic trees behind the Duel Arena outside of the Mage Arena. Bank in the Duel Arena or the Gnome Stronghold and if you've completed mourning's end part 1 there are magic trees near there. Cutting goes faster if you have a woodcutting level of over 85 or 90 but even with 99 it is still very slow. It is possible that cutting yew trees brings faster money than this. If you have a full Lumberjack set (get it from Temple Trekking) you get more exp per log and if you have a strung rabbit foot (which is highly recommended) you get more bird nests, which also helps bring in more money.

steps.title: Make sure you have the following skills and equipment:
steps.content: Make sure you have the following skills and equipment: A decent pickaxe (Rune+) 30 mining (higher levels give you more money per hour Decent armor that doesn't weigh you down, such as sacred clay.

steps.title: Go to the Seers' Village Bank.
steps.content: Go to the Seers' Village Bank.

steps.title: Go north-west until you reach a building with coal tracks.
steps.content: Go north-west until you reach a building with coal tracks.

steps.title: Follow the coal tracks until you reach a river.
steps.content: Follow the coal tracks until you reach a river. Go south and you'll see a log that you can cross. Walk across and you are now in the mining area.

steps.title: Mine coal until you have a full inventory.
steps.content: Mine coal until you have a full inventory. .

steps.title: Click on a coal truck and deposit the coal there.
steps.content: Click on a coal truck and deposit the coal there. You can fit 120 coal in at a time, you can fit more than 120 if you have completed the seers village achievement diary

steps.title: Fill your inventory once the truck is full.
steps.content: Fill your inventory once the truck is full.

steps.title: Go back to the bank and deposit the coal.
steps.content: Go back to the bank and deposit the coal.

steps.title: Go to a building slightly north-west of the bank with a mining symbol on it.
steps.content: Go to a building slightly north-west of the bank with a mining symbol on it. There is a truck in there that holds your coal.

steps.title: Get your coal out of the truck and transfer it all into the bank.
steps.content: Get your coal out of the truck and transfer it all into the bank. This is the most efficient way to get coal, aside from miscellania

steps.title: For this method, you will be killing cave slimes, the requirements are
steps.content: For this method, you will be killing cave slimes, the requirements are 17 slayer Decent armor and stats Anti-posion (++ recomended) Any type of light source can be used, but open flames tend to make swamp explode. Once your light source is extinguished, you are eaten alive by tiny insects. A rope

steps.title: Enter the Lumbridge Caves.
steps.content: Enter the Lumbridge Caves.

steps.title: Kill cave slimes and pick up the swamp tar they drop.
steps.content: Kill cave slimes and pick up the swamp tar they drop. They drop 1-10 tar per kill. Beware cave slimes do minimal damage with poison, but it adds up.

steps.title: Make sure you meet the requirements:
steps.content: Make sure you meet the requirements: 60+ Combat (80+ recommended) Food in bank. The amount and type depends on the time you wish to spend there. If your weaker than level 70 you should do magic or range. Dragon+ armor and Rune+ weapons.

steps.title: Home teleport to the karamja lodestone.
steps.content: Home teleport to the karamja lodestone. You could also use a glory amulet for a quicker teleport.

steps.title: Enter the volcano and into the cave that leads to the Tzhaar City.
steps.content: Enter the volcano and into the cave that leads to the Tzhaar City.

steps.title: Attack the monsters inside; be aware of your health as they are quite strong.
steps.content: Attack the monsters inside; be aware of your health as they are quite strong. A Ring of Wealth is advised as it makes those rare drops easier to obtain.

steps.title: Know the monsters in the city and what they drop:
steps.content: Know the monsters in the city and what they drop: TzHaar-Hur (Level 74) Beware if you attack this monster with a 149 or 133 nearby they will mage you!

steps.title: Pick up the drops.
steps.content: Pick up the drops. Most of the time they will drop nothing more than some tokkul or obsidian charms, but you are looking for drops like the obsidian maul or cape, which sell for a few hundred thousand in the grand exchange.

steps.title: Obtain:
steps.content: Obtain: Knowledge and possession of the Ivandis Flail (complete Legacy of Seergaze) A high combat level (at least 90) Lots of food (lobster or better) Teak pyre logs and level 40 firemaking A tinderbox

steps.title: Travel to Paterdomus and either temple trek or walk down to Burgh de Rott.
steps.content: Travel to Paterdomus and either temple trek or walk down to Burgh de Rott.

steps.title: Board the boat to Meiyerditch.
steps.content: Board the boat to Meiyerditch.

steps.title: Battle the Vyrewatch leveled 110, 120, 130, or 140 with your Ivandis Flail.
steps.content: Battle the Vyrewatch leveled 110, 120, 130, or 140 with your Ivandis Flail. Make sure that, on the minimap, the Vyrewatch are above solid ground or you will not be able to collect the drops.

steps.title: Collect vyre corpses.
steps.content: Collect vyre corpses.

steps.title: Bank as needed.
steps.content: Bank as needed.

steps.title: Travel back to Paterdomus when you have a sufficient amount or your food has run out.
steps.content: Travel back to Paterdomus when you have a sufficient amount or your food has run out.

steps.title: Go down the steps and burn them in the Pyres.
steps.content: Go down the steps and burn them in the Pyres.

steps.title: Collect the Columbarium Key.
steps.content: Collect the Columbarium Key.

steps.title: Use it on a wooden recess and reap the spoils
steps.content: Use it on a wooden recess and reap the spoils

steps.title: Make sure you meet the requirements:
steps.content: Make sure you meet the requirements: Complete (or started) Zogre Flesh Eaters quest 60+ range At least 250 mithril brutal arrows 1 relicym's balm (3/4) Food Ogre composite bow

steps.title: Go into the Zogre Tomb; before the stairs go down the gap between the Ogre coffin and wall.
steps.content: Go into the Zogre Tomb; before the stairs go down the gap between the Ogre coffin and wall.

steps.title: Range the Zogres/Skogres, collect the keys, and bury the bones.
steps.content: Range the Zogres/Skogres, collect the keys, and bury the bones. You could also buy these keys in the Grand exchange, however they are hard to buy, and will cut into your profit.

steps.title: Open the coffins with the keys.
steps.content: Open the coffins with the keys. You are looking for the Raurg bones, priced at 50k most of the time. These are used by people looking to complete their daily challenge which required them to bury 5 of the bones, making them very expensive.

steps.title: Make sure you meet the requirements:
steps.content: Make sure you meet the requirements: Completed the quests of Throne of Miscellania and Royal Trouble At least 45 woodcutting or 40 fishing.

steps.title: Go to your kingdom, and deposit 1.2m+ into the coffers.
steps.content: Go to your kingdom, and deposit 1.2m+ into the coffers.

steps.title: Come back to your kingdom everyday.
steps.content: Come back to your kingdom everyday. Chop down some maple trees to keep your rating at 100%. You should get back a minimum of 1.2m but more than this if you can afford.

steps.title: Put all your villagers on herbs, and the rest on maple for the most efficient money.
steps.content: Put all your villagers on herbs, and the rest on maple for the most efficient money. The reason this is most effective is not only will the herbs give you mass amounts of high-tier herbs such as ranarr and avantoe, they also give you the seeds. With maples, the logs are just icing on the cake as what you are really looking for is the bird's nest. If you open them, you are looking for high levelled tree seeds like magic and yew. Even if you don't get lucky with the nests, crushing them makes them worth 8 thousand a piece due to their use in Saradomin's Brews. Do something else to fill the day, because you only need to return once.

steps.title: Always check prices before doing this method.
steps.content: Always check prices before doing this method. Depending on the market at the time, it could make you lose thousands after all that work. This is very important: Buy the hides at a low price to make more money. You could lose half the value if you don't. Be patient!

steps.title: Meet the basic requirements:
steps.content: Meet the basic requirements: Dragon hides (Green, blue, red, black, they all work.) 20 GP per hide for tanning Energy potions (optional) Boots of Lightness (optional)

steps.title: Get as many dragon hides as you can afford from the Grand Exchange, or kill the dragons yourself.
steps.content: Get as many dragon hides as you can afford from the Grand Exchange, or kill the dragons yourself. Make sure you still have 20 GP per dragon hide (540 GP per load). REMEBER

steps.title: Go to the West bank of Varrock, and just south of the bank there will be a tanner for the hides, and just run back and forth between the tanner and the bank until all of the hides are tanned.
steps.content: Go to the West bank of Varrock, and just south of the bank there will be a tanner for the hides, and just run back and forth between the tanner and the bank until all of the hides are tanned.

steps.title: Go back to the Grand Exchange, and sell for near medium price.
steps.content: Go back to the Grand Exchange, and sell for near medium price.

steps.title: Know if this is a good method for you.
steps.content: Know if this is a good method for you. It's recommended for Combat 50-60+.

steps.title: Play soul wars, the portal is in Edgeville.
steps.content: Play soul wars, the portal is in Edgeville. Every game played wins you zeal. Lose = 1 Zeal Tie = 2 Zeal Win = 3 Zeal

steps.title: Go to the rewards person near the bank chest and always put Gamble which costs 2 points.
steps.content: Go to the rewards person near the bank chest and always put Gamble which costs 2 points. You can get a variety of items from this ranging from 250k in coins to wyvern bones. If you keep spending your coins on this, eventually you will get lucky. Contrary to popular belief, you cannot get things like Elysian Spirit shield or White party hats, so don't be expecting things like that.

steps.title: Meet the requirements.
steps.content: Meet the requirements. Required level: 85 mining.

steps.title: Take the ship to port phasmatys, then go southwest where you'll find a hole and bunch of rocks.
steps.content: Take the ship to port phasmatys, then go southwest where you'll find a hole and bunch of rocks.

steps.title: Prospect them until you find the runite ore, then mine it.
steps.content: Prospect them until you find the runite ore, then mine it.

steps.title: Get a full inventory bank at port phasmatys.
steps.content: Get a full inventory bank at port phasmatys.

steps.title: Repeat until satisfied.
steps.content: Repeat until satisfied.

steps.title: Go to GE and sell your wares and watch how they sell.
steps.content: Go to GE and sell your wares and watch how they sell.

steps.title: Or, alternatively you could mine in the wild, it is unlikely that you will get attacked but there it is a risk.
steps.content: Or, alternatively you could mine in the wild, it is unlikely that you will get attacked but there it is a risk. To get there you could run or use the teleport in the ancients spell book to level 44 wild and just run west, and for banking you should run to 20 wild and teleport.

steps.title: Keep some tips in mind as you go:
steps.content: Keep some tips in mind as you go: This way is close to a bank, so you can get heaps. You should use a dragon pickaxe.

steps.title: Meet the requirements:
steps.content: Meet the requirements: Smoking Kills (Requires 35 Slayer and 85+ Combat) High Combat level All the required equipment for whatever slayer tasks

steps.title: Start by choosing whether you're going for Magic Dart
steps.content: Start by choosing whether you're going for Magic Dart

steps.title: Do Slayer Tasks to maximize the money go for part 2.
steps.content: Do Slayer Tasks to maximize the money go for part 2.

steps.title: Part 1 Magic Dart:
steps.content: Part 1 Magic Dart: For this you absolutely have to have Smoking Kills done and it would be very much preferred if you had Shilo Village done, 50+ Slayer, and 100+ combat so you could get tasks from Duradel.

steps.title: Once you have 9 of the easy tasks done, you should do one of the hardest tasks you can do, whether it be Sumona up to Kuradal, just do that and you'll get 5 times the amount of points you would have.
steps.content: Once you have 9 of the easy tasks done, you should do one of the hardest tasks you can do, whether it be Sumona up to Kuradal, just do that and you'll get 5 times the amount of points you would have.

steps.title: Make sure the 50th task is the absolute hardest one because for the 50th task, you get 15 times the amount of points you would have!
steps.content: Make sure the 50th task is the absolute hardest one because for the 50th task, you get 15 times the amount of points you would have!

steps.title: Do these tasks and once you have saved many points, head over to a slayer master for your slayer dart runes!
steps.content: Do these tasks and once you have saved many points, head over to a slayer master for your slayer dart runes! Note: Although Turael/Spira don't give any points for their tasks, you may still get runes with them. Once at the slayer master, right click them choose the option "rewards". A box should appear and there should be an icon for buying runes from slayer dart. Other than a slayer helm which costs 400 points, you shouldn't really buy anything else.

steps.title: Once you've bought you're 250 casts of slayer dart(costs 35 points and contains 250 death runes and 1000 mind runes), head over to the grand exchange and sell your runes for approximately 100k
steps.content: Once you've bought you're 250 casts of slayer dart(costs 35 points and contains 250 death runes and 1000 mind runes), head over to the grand exchange and sell your runes for approximately 100k

steps.title: Keep all of the valuables from the slayer tasks.
steps.content: Keep all of the valuables from the slayer tasks.

steps.title: Bring good gear.
steps.content: Bring good gear. The best way to kill these is with magic, so have at least 70 stats. These are also poisonous, so bring some anti-poisons.

steps.title: Go to the Exiled Kalphite Hive.
steps.content: Go to the Exiled Kalphite Hive. This is located just north Menaphos. Bring a waterskin two as this is in the desert.

steps.title: Kill Exiled Kalphite maraders.
steps.content: Kill Exiled Kalphite maraders. These drop 2 grimy herbs at a time, and more commonly high level herbs than low level.

steps.title: Go to a popular PvP world.
steps.content: Go to a popular PvP world. They include world 1 and 2, and 18.

steps.title: Wear nothing.
steps.content: Wear nothing. You will be going into the wilderness, so you don't want to lose anything.

steps.title: Find someone that just died.
steps.content: Find someone that just died. Stand over where they died and wait for about a minute.

steps.title: Collect their food and potions.
steps.content: Collect their food and potions. Most of the time, pkers only pick up the things like armor and weapons, and leave their potions and food on the ground, free for others. Only pick up expensive food, however, like sharks and rocktails.

steps.title: Plant high leveled herbs.
steps.content: Plant high leveled herbs. Preferably anything above toadflax can make you a decent profit. Be sure to treat the plots with supercompost. If you don't, there is a very high chance they will die and you will waste your seeds. The three places that you can plant herbs are Catherby North of Ardougne Trollheim South of Falador.

steps.title: Harvest the herbs.
steps.content: Harvest the herbs. If you wield the magic secateurs you get from completing the quest "Fairy Tale part 1", you have the potential to get more crops, combine this with the greenfingers aura and you will get double the herbs! Be sure to clean the herbs for maximum profit.

steps.title: Go to Canfis.
steps.content: Go to Canfis. Have 3 small fishing nets and 3 rope, and with around 35 hunter.

steps.title: Go southeast of the lodestone to the young trees.
steps.content: Go southeast of the lodestone to the young trees. Click on the trees and set up a trap. When your trap is activated get the swamp lizard. These are used in summoning to make swamp titans, so it is in high demand.

steps.title: Complete the quest "Nature Spirit" and have the nature spirit bless your silver sickle.
steps.content: Complete the quest "Nature Spirit" and have the nature spirit bless your silver sickle.

steps.title: Charge your prayer.
steps.content: Charge your prayer. Be sure to bring something to restore your prayer points, such as super restore or prayer potions. You may want to have the Holy Wrench from the Great Brain Robbery.

steps.title: Equip the sickle and go into the Mort Myre Swamp.
steps.content: Equip the sickle and go into the Mort Myre Swamp. Find and area that has at least logs near each other. Cast Bloom and pick up the fungi on the logs. These are used in herblore making Super Energy potions to train herblore.

steps.title: Get your gear together.
steps.content: Get your gear together. You'll want at least 80+ stats in whatever combat you are using the most effective defensive gear you can get. Have a few prayer potions, rocktails, and overloads if you can make them.

steps.title: Teleport to the God Wars Dungeon.
steps.content: Teleport to the God Wars Dungeon. If you have not completed Love Song, and don't have access to this teleport, use the Trollheim teleport. If you don't have access to this either, use the Burthrope home teleport and climb the mountain.

steps.title: Gain killcount.
steps.content: Gain killcount. This is done by killing the followers of each god. These are automatically aggressive unless you are wearing a piece of equipment specific to that god. You need to kill 40 minions of the desired boss to continue, along with 70 agility, constitution, strength, an attack for Armadyl, Zamorak, Bandos, and Saradomin respectively.

steps.title: Kill the boss.
steps.content: Kill the boss. The most profitable is Armadyl, with the Armadyl hilt and crossbow being very expensive, but also very hard. Bandos is the easiest boss, and gives you the least valuable drops. Pick whatever suits you best.

steps.title: Get 81 slayer.
steps.content: Get 81 slayer. This is the required level to damage your enemies and opponents. You are also going to want to have a high range level, as it is difficult to hit these creatures at a lower level. Gear up with your best range weapon, armor, and food, with super ranging pots.

steps.title: Go to the Ascension Dungeon.
steps.content: Go to the Ascension Dungeon. This is located south of Feldip Hills in a small Monastery. The Oo'glog lodestone is very close to this.

steps.title: Kill Gladii.
steps.content: Kill Gladii. Get the keys they drop, from Primus to Sexes, they are worth about 250k a piece. For some more profit, pick up the noted maple logs and potatoes with cheese.
